file_name: NETGEAR,INC_04_21_2003-EX-10.16- AMENDMENT #2 TO THE DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT.txt

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment is entered into effective October 1,1996 ("Amendment Date") by and between NETGEAR, Inc. ("NETGEAR"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Bay Networks, Inc., and Ingram Micro ("Distributor") acting on behalf of itself and its affiliates.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment is entered into effective October 1,1996 ("Amendment Date") by and between NETGEAR, Inc. ("NETGEAR"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Bay Networks, Inc., and Ingram Micro ("Supplier") acting on behalf of itself and its affiliates.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Supplier' introduces uncertainty. Later sections refer to 'Distributor', and it is not explicitly stated that 'Supplier' and 'Distributor' are the same, potentially creating confusion regarding obligations and rights.

perturbation.original_text: During the initial one year period beginning on the Amendment Date, Distributor shall be the only distributor appointed by NETGEAR in [*], subject to Distributor conducting mutually agreed to marketing activities as described in the Marketing Plan for [*] to be developed and agreed to by and between the parties and which shall be attached to and made a part of this Agreement as Exhibit 4a.
perturbation.changed_text: During the initial one year period beginning on the Amendment Date, Supplier shall be the only distributor appointed by NETGEAR in [*], subject to Distributor conducting mutually agreed to marketing activities as described in the Marketing Plan for [*] to be developed and agreed to by and between the parties and which shall be attached to and made a part of this Agreement as Exhibit 4a.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'Supplier' and then switching back to 'Distributor' in the same sentence introduces ambiguity. Does 'Distributor' here still refer to Ingram Micro, or some other entity? The changed text modifies the original text by using the terms 'supplier' and 'distributor' interchangeably. This creates uncertainty about whether both terms refer to the same business entity.

perturbation.original_text: THIS AMENDMENT (the "Amendment") is entered into this 15th day of July 1998, by and between INGRAM MICRO INC. ("Ingram") and NETGEAR, INC. ("Vendor").
perturbation.changed_text: THIS AMENDMENT (the "Amendment") is entered into this 15th day of July 1998, by and between INGRAM MICRO INC. ("Ingram") and NETGEAR, INC. ("Seller").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Vendor' to 'Seller' may lead to confusion as previous agreements and sections use the term 'Vendor.' It is unclear if 'Seller' has the same responsibilities and obligations as 'Vendor.'
